com.coolhandsoftware.trailtrace

Class DrawnPathManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.coolhandsoftware.trailtrace.DrawnPathManager

  • public class DrawnPathManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages the traces drawn in the RouteDrawFragment and switching in between pixels and GeoPoints. It also smoothes the line that the user draws when the measure button is pressed. This object preserves the state of the points by extending the Fragment class and setting retain instance to true.
    Author:
    David Cully

      • storeXyCoordinates

        public void storeXyCoordinates(java.util.ArrayList<<any>> pixelCoordinates,
                               org.osmdroid.views.Projection projection)
        Called when the user is inputting coordinates via touch. Stores coordinates in lat/lon format pre-emptively.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - The raw screen coordinates, in pixels (x,y).
        projection - The projection used to convert the coordinates to (latitude, longitude).

      • processStoredXyCoordinates

        public java.util.ArrayList<org.osmdroid.util.GeoPoint> processStoredXyCoordinates()
        Called when the user presses the "measure" button. Smoothes out stored coordinates, builds GeoPoint list, and returns them.
        Returns:
        The processed list of GeoPoints.

        public boolean hasStoredPoints()

      • angleFormedByPoints

        private double angleFormedByPoints(<any> first,
                                   <any> second,
                                   <any> third)
        This function returns the angle formed by the three points passed as parameters.
        Parameters:
        first - The first point (the end of one vector).
        second - The second point (the vertex of both vectors).
        third - The third point (the end of the other vector).
        Returns:
        An angle measurement between 0 and 180 degrees.
